channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road sunk / dip, 10th September
item.description:
Near the gateway to the public open space on Coldpool Lane. The road surface has sunk, creating quite a violent jolt when travelling at 40mph. Dangerous for motorcyclists and very uncomfortable for passengers travelling in wheelchair vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light on pathway obstructed by vegetation, 10th September
item.description:
The lamp post has a number 22 on. The first picture gives one unobstructed view. The second picture shows the level of obstruction. The third picture shows you that no light shines onto the path into this particularly dark area of the pathway. For those walking on the path at night or dusk it presents a hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Craven Drive, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hubble Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Road Closed signs left after work on Blacksmith Lane, 10th September
item.description:
Opposite the junction of Blacksmith Lane and Sandfield Road with The Piece, road closed signs are laying down on the grass by the electricity substation. These were left behind recently after the road was opened following work on Blacksmith Lane at the junction of Church Road (by the shops).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Piece, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Tarmac is not up to fence bordering propertu, 10th September
item.description:
We recently moved into 177 Hatherley Road and have had to remove a hedge which fronted the property as it had grown out of control and parts were dead. We are replacing the hedge with a fence along the front boundary. When the pavement was previously tarmacked it was only done up to the overgrown hedge and now the hedge has been removed, this leaves a large gap between the new fence and the tarmac. This could be a trip hazard as the pavement is used constantly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Lighting issue, 10th September
item.description:
Lighting in the underpass on west side of RaB is inadequate - a safety risk as you can't easily see oncoming cyclists or debris on the path
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leckhampton Road, uneven, flooded dangerous walkway., 10th September
item.description:
The pavement on the West side of Leckhampton Rd from the Norwood Arms to Moorend Road is in a terrible state. Thank you for surfacing Tryes Road - please can we have the same treatment - our pavement is almost unwalkable and is becoming treacherous, especially for the elderly, many of whom live in Mornington and Moorend.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard shell is damaged/vandalised problem, 10th September
item.description:
Customer reports that the "Max Speed 20 - When Lights Flash" sign at the location has been stuck on permanently, but not flashing, throughout the school holidays up until now. Please can this be repaired asap.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 10th September
item.description:
Give and take 28 days plus temporary footway closure please footway abrupt level different 6000x600x25 mm tarmac patch stats required stats required number 1 (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
